Yes, the National Parivar Mediclaim Plus Policy covers maternity expenses.

Here are the conditions and details for maternity coverage:

**Coverage Details:**
*   The Company will indemnify Maternity Expenses for any female Insured Person, including Pre-Natal and Post-Natal Hospitalisation expenses per delivery, and expenses for necessary vaccination for the New Born Baby.
*   Maternity Expenses include:
    *   Medical treatment expenses traceable to childbirth (including complicated deliveries and caesarean sections incurred during Hospitalization).
    *   Expenses towards lawful medical termination of pregnancy during the Policy Period.
*   **New Born Baby Coverage:** The New Born Baby is automatically covered from birth under the mother's Sum Insured for up to 3 months of age. After 3 months, the baby is covered only if specifically included in the Policy mid-term with the requisite premium paid.
*   **Ectopic pregnancy:** While generally excluded under the Maternity section, it is covered under 'In-patient treatment' if established by medical reports.

**Limits (per insured person, in a policy year):**
*   **For one plan type:** Up to INR 30,000 for normal delivery and INR 50,000 for caesarean section.
*   **For other plan types:** Up to Sum Insured (SI).
*   **Vaccination for New Born Baby:** As part of Maternity.

**Conditions/Exclusions:**
*   The female Insured Person must have been continuously covered for at least 24 months before availing this benefit.
*   **Age Limit:** Covered female Insured Persons must be between eighteen (18) years and forty-five (45) years of age.
*   **Waiting Period:** There is a Waiting Period of twenty-four (24) months for delivery or termination. This waiting period may be waived only in the case of delivery, miscarriage, or abortion induced by an accident.
*   **Number of Deliveries/Terminations:** Coverage is limited to a maximum of two deliveries or terminations (or either) paid under the Policy and its Renewals.
*   Only one delivery or lawful medical termination of pregnancy is covered during a single Policy Period.
*   Maternity Expenses of a Surrogate Mother are excluded, unless the claim is admitted under Section 3.1.15 (Infertility).
*   Pre and post hospitalisation expenses, other than pre and post natal treatment, are excluded.

Yes, the medical expenses incurred for an organ donor's hospitalization during the Policy Period for harvesting of the organ donated to an Insured Person are covered.

However, this coverage is subject to the following conditions:
*   The organ donation must conform to the Transplantation of Human Organs Act 1994 (and its amendments).
*   The organ must be used for an Insured Person who has been medically advised to undergo an organ transplant.
*   The Medical Expenses must be incurred in respect of the organ donor as an in-patient in a Hospital.
*   A claim must have been admitted under the In-patient Treatment Section in respect of the Insured Person undergoing the organ transplant.

Certain expenses are specifically excluded for organ donors:
*   Pre-hospitalization Medical Expenses or Post-Hospitalization Medical Expenses of the organ donor.
*   Costs directly or indirectly associated with the acquisition of the donor's organ.
*   Medical Expenses where the organ transplant is experimental or investigational.
*   Any medical treatment or complication in respect of the donor, consequent to harvesting.
*   Any expenses related to organ transportation or preservation.

The No Claim Discount (NCD) offered in this policy is as follows:

*   **For policies with a term of one year:** A flat 5% NCD is allowed on the base premium, provided no claims are reported in the expiring policy.
*   **For policies with a term exceeding one year:** The NCD amount for each claim-free policy year is aggregated and allowed on renewal. The total aggregate NCD allowed will not exceed flat 5% of the total base premium for the term of the policy.

A 'Hospital' is defined as any institution established for in-patient care and day care treatment of disease/injuries that is registered as a hospital with local authorities under the Clinical Establishments (Registration and Regulation) Act, 2010 or related enactments.

Alternatively, an institution qualifies as a 'Hospital' if it complies with all the following minimum criteria:
i. Has qualified nursing staff under its employment round the clock.
ii. Has at least ten inpatient beds in towns with a population of less than ten lacs, and fifteen inpatient beds in all other places.
iii. Has qualified medical practitioner(s) in charge round the clock.
iv. Has a fully equipped operation theatre of its own where surgical procedures are carried out.
v. Maintains daily records of patients and makes them accessible to the Company's authorized personnel.
